alert.note: Alert for South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 13 at 5:28AM PDT until April 13 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow showers. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades including including Highways 58, 62, 230, and 138. This also includes Crater Lake, Diamond Lake, Crescent Lake, the resort at Willamette Pass, and Union Creek. * WHEN...Until 11 AM PDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall rates may approach an inch an hour at times. Snowfall will not be constant. Additional moderate snow may fall again tonight. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring, imminent, or likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
